page.title: 06HOUSING.
page.content: The village can be divided into four main groups:_ 1. LARGE HOUSES. There is an Elizabethan moated Manor built from a monastery in the sixteenth century. A Queen Anne farmhouse with private grounds. A Victorian Mansion, now Hall Farmhouse. The Old Rectory built in 1845 standing in two acreas of grounds. 2.FLINT COTTAGES. This group many of which have been altered to make larger properties and owned by the wealthier families rather than the farm workers as of old. 3.MODERN PRIVATE HOUSES. These are mostly owned and occupied by the younger families. 4.COUNCIL HOUSES. The Elms estate is a modern council estate where most of the origonal villagers live.
